intro: Oenothera hookeri var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oenothera hookeri var. parviflora is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
